result.execSummary:
The defendant James Lamont Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Email from the victim; received and filed. nm

Defendant James Lamont Thompson in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant James Lamont Thompson in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nm
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days served. Consecutive to count 3 and any other sentence.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years.

AS TO COUNT 3:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days served. Consecutive to count 2 and any other sentence.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Serve 60 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review. As to both counts.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No VIOLENT contact with victim.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.

*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court has no objection to transfer of probation to the county defendant resides in.

Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit.

Attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth in court, defendant James Lamont Thompson not in court, in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nm
HELD OFF THE RECORD. Case calendared for sentencing hearing. Court in trial on another pending matter with the district attorney on this matter. Court orders case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded.
AS TO COUNT 1:
  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2 and 3:
  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4.

Defendant James Lamont Thompson in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant James Lamont Thompson in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nm  
AS TO COUNT 2, On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Battery (Domestic Abuse), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), 968.075(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.
AS TO COUNT 3, On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 968.075(1)(a), a Class B Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 5, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth in court, defendant James Lamont Thompson not in court, in custody and not produced.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: nm 
Held off the record. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 9, 2017 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 22, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth in court, defendant James Lamont Thompson not in court, in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nm  
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Held off the record. Case calendared for status conference. Defense counsel in trial in Branch 17, Court also in trial. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for April 10, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth in court, defendant James Lamont Thompson not in court, in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for schedule conference. Victim made statement requesting modification of no contact order as to this matter. Parties made arguments as to bail. Court orders no contact order modified to be no violent contact order.  Case adjourned for status conference.  Status conference scheduled for March 20, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Court in trial on another speedy trial. Case spun to Branch 21, Judge Davis for Prelim Waiver.

Defendant James Lamont Thompson in court with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.  Defendant James Lamont Thompson in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
BRANCH 21 for BRANCH 4. 
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 8, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Marissa L.; Christa M. or Randy P

Defendant James Lamont Thompson in court with attorney Zoe Plovanich.  Defendant James Lamont Thompson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2017 at 08:30 am.
